title: Design and evaluation of a parrot-to-parrot video-calling system (2023)
summary:
Design and evaluation of a parrot-to-parrot video-calling system (2023)

The article discusses the design and evaluation of a parrot-to-parrot video-calling system. The author describes their personal experience with a male Barraband (Superb) parrot who enjoys watching bird videos on a tablet. The parrot has exhibited new behaviors, including begging for food and stealing meat. The author also notes that the parrot makes a wider variety of noises and seems to be trying to replicate human speech. The article raises the question of whether excessive screen time can negatively impact a parrot's behavior and socialization. The author also discusses the idea that parrots may become addicted to bird videos as a form of socialization in captivity. The article concludes by emphasizing that parrots have unfulfilled needs in captivity and that they may pursue what they find to work for them, even if it is bothersome for their keepers.
